text: Hey, by the way, do you like this scarf?

speaker: Marshall
text: Posititochadochmecochepopocha.

speaker: Marshall
text: Lawyered.

speaker: Lily
text: Okay, that's also a made-up word.

speaker: Marshall
text: Okay. Lily, what do you want from me? I want you to be the person I fell in love with.

speaker: Barney
text: Niled it.

speaker: Museum guard
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Barney
text: Thank God you're here. She's been messing with the exhibits.

speaker: Zoey
text: I got married when I was 22 to a man who calls himself The Captain.

speaker: Ted
text: He seems like a good guy. He wears those red pants.

speaker: Zoey
text: I hate boats, Ted. I do, I hate 'em. I can't be on them. I can't be near them. I can't even think about them without getting seasick. You want to know why I want to save that building? Because when I look up at The Arcadian, I see something big and solid, and right now everything else in my life just feels like I'm on a boat. I know it's crazy to care that much about a building.

speaker: Ted
text: It's not crazy at all. I'm the same way. Look, Zoey, The Arcadian should be a landmark, it should. The lion head stonework is iconic. I hate that we have to tear it down. I hate working for GNB. They're a bunch of wieners and gonads.

speaker: Zoey
text: Ted, that was... really easy.

speaker: Ted
text: What?
Ted's voice (on a recording): They're a bunch of wieners and gonads.

speaker: Zoey
text: This should be useful.
Ted from 2030: And in that moment, another headline appeared before my eyes.

speaker: Ted
text: You tricked me.

speaker: Zoey
text: Well, it the bug room, Ted. Your ass just got bugged. Oh, the offer still stands. We simply must have you out on the boat sometime.

speaker: Guard
text: Well, aren't you two clever. Well, guess what, this museum has seen every kind of prank you can think of. Mummies playing poker, penguins sticking out of volcanoes, dinosaurs from the Cretaceous period hanging out with dinosaurs from the Jurassic period. One time a kid knocked down the blue whale. You name it...

speaker: Robin
text: I'm sorry. Did you say someone knocked down the blue whale?

speaker: Guard

Ted from 2030: Kids, in the fall of 2010, I was hosting my very first Thanksgiving. And I wanted it to be unforgettable.

speaker: Ted
text: Instead of stuffing, I'm going to fill the turkey with... a slightly smaller turkey. It's called a Turturkeykey!

speaker: Lily

speaker: Robin

text: What? No! You can't go now. It's the night before Thanksgiving. College chicks are back in town. Their moms just made a snide comment about the weight they gained. They called her a bitch, but deep down, they know she's right. And they're about to walk through that door, where we will be waiting with some light beer and some rock hard approval. Wh-what u-up?

Blitz had gotten the curse from Jerry Windheim, back in freshman year, who got it years before that from Davey Beaterman. The original Blitz, Matt Blitz, was a guy who went to Wesleyan back in the '60s. He dropped out right before the school went co-ed. And then, Thanksgiving morning...

text: Yeah... here's the thing about me and tools... the only one I know how to use is attached to me, and I am not going to try putting it in the TV. Again.

text: Okay, that's ridiculous. Everyone should know how to use tools.

speaker: Barney
text: Well, here's our screwdriver now. (Barney opens the door, then whispers loudly:) Guys, I'm pretty sure that's not Luis, but I can't be certain. Someone introduce yourself.

text: Barney, I... I got your letter.

speaker: Barney
text: Dad?

text: I can't believe Barney is talking to his dad right now.

speaker: Lily
text: "So, how 'bout those last 30 Super Bowls"?

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, now I feel bad about making fun of him for the tool thing. My dad was the one who taught me all that stuff.

speaker: Robin
text: Well, to be fair, everyone has some glaring gap in knowledge, something really obvious you somehow never learned.

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, but a screwdriver? Come on, I don't have any gaps that fundamental.

speaker: Robin
text: Really? I seem to recall...

speaker: Ted
text: Daniel Burnham was an architect whose ever-shifting style and aesthetic made him a true architectural chamma-leeon. And only the most gifted chamma-leeon could've designed classic beaux arts masterpieces right alongside sleek modern flatirons. His name might as well have been Daniel Chamma-leeon.

speaker: Student
text: Um, Professor? Uh, do you mean "chameleon"?

speaker: Ted
text: Betty, I'm pretty sure it's pronounced "chamma-leeon," so... Class dismissed. No homework. For a while.

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, I learned that word by reading it. That's how I've always pronounced it.

speaker: Robin
text: Ted, that wasn't easy. It took a lot of "ch-aracter" to admit that.

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, Scherbatsky. You want to tussle? I'll tussle.

speaker: Robin
text: You want to tussle? Let's tussle.

speaker: Ted
text: Marine biologist.

speaker: Robin
text: Please, no.

text: So this really sucks, but I'm going to be in the North Pole for the next three months.

text: Seriously? The North Pole? Okay, pal, if you want to break up with me, just tell it to me straight. Don't pretend you're going someplace we all know doesn't exist.

speaker: Scott
text: Um, I'm going to be studying the mating habits of...

speaker: Robin
text: Of who? Santa's elves? Rudolph? You know what? I'm going on a trip, too, Scott. It, uh, starts in Narnia. It works its way up to Candyland, and then, hey, congratulate me, because I'm the new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher at Hogwarts. Expelliarmus!

speaker: Scott
text: Robin, the North Pole is a real place. You know that, right?

speaker: Robin
text: So... you want to get pizza later? Or...

text: I think we should break up.

speaker: Robin
text: I still think about him in the shower.

speaker: Ted
text: Hey. Tell us everything. How'd it go, bud?

text: Where do I begin?
Jerry (Barney's dad): So, I'm not sure how to start this.

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah. I think I need a drink.

speaker: Jerry
text: Me, too.

speaker: Both
text: Glen McKenna, neat.

speaker: Jerry
text: Nice order. Up top.

text: Look, it's been 30 years. And now you just show up out of nowhere? This is... this is going to take me a minute.

text: Yeah. I understand. By the way, hell of a tie. Is that Italian silk?

speaker: Barney
text: I love you, Daddy. I'm so glad we're best friends now.

text: Make a muscle.

speaker: Jerry

speaker: Barney
text: Ah!

speaker: Barney
text: Guys, my dad's awesome. He's the mother of all fathers. Check this out.

speaker: Barney
text: Hey, back when I was a kid, you used to be a roadie. Do you still do that?

speaker: Jerry
text: Not anymore. Back in '83 I'm lugging amps for The Stones through West Germany, and their tour manager loses his arms, bus-surfing through a tunnel. Gnarly. Long story short, I've been managing tours ever since, and that dude high-fives people with his face now.
Barney, laughing: You're funny. My dad's funny.

speaker: Barney
text: So, all these years, there's this one question I've been dying to ask him.

speaker: Lily
text: Why did you abandon me?

speaker: Marshall
text: Why'd you wait so long to contact me?

speaker: Robin
text: You've hurt me before, why should I trust you now?

speaker: Barney
text: Do you... get laid a lot?

speaker: Jerry
text: Big-time. Observe.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, my God, that took you five seconds.

speaker: Jerry
text: Oh, was it that long? Life's too short for chatty chicks.

speaker: Barney
text: You're a master. You are legen... wait for it...
Barney:...daddy! Legendaddy! The man is a god. And he's still out there, living the dream.

speaker: Jerry
text: So I'm going to Sydney tomorrow with Bon Jovi. I'll be on the road the rest of the year.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, that's cool.

speaker: Jerry
text: Say, you want to join me for the tour's Asian leg?

speaker: Barney
text: This is going to be the second-most fun I've ever had on an Asian leg. (both laughing)

speaker: Lily
text: Barney, we... we know you're psyched, but just... be careful.

speaker: Barney
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Ted
text: Well, this guy has flaked out on your whole life. It sounds like he just might be telling you what you want to hear.

speaker: Robin
text: Barney, we just don't want to see you get hurt.

speaker: Barney
text: First of all, Robin, my dad could beat up your dad. Second, you don't have to worry. He's cool. Now if you'll excuse me... I have to go renew my passport, and get a travel-sized rotating Vietnamese Shame Wheel. Don't ask; you're not ready.

text: I hope Barney's dad isn't just pretending to be something he's not, you know?

speaker: Lily
text: Yeah. That would make Jerry a real chamma-leeon.

text: You have gaps, too, Lily.

speaker: Lily
text: You got nothing on me.

text: Hey, Lily, can you toss me a beer?

speaker: Lily
text: Sure, honey. (She throws the key toward the wall besides Marshall)

text: You have terrible aim.

speaker: Lily

text: Oh, my God. Barney's dad.

text: Hey, uh, you're Barney's friends, right?

speaker: Marshall
text: Yeah, but... aren't you supposed to be off managing some tour in Australia?

speaker: Jerry
text: What? No, I... I'm a driving instructor up in White Plains. And I need your help... Barney won't return my calls.

speaker: Lily
text: What do you mean, Barney won't return your calls? He said you two had an amazing night together.

speaker: Jerry
text: That's not what happened.

speaker: Barney
text: I'm not sure how to start this.

speaker: Jerry
text: Yeah.

text: I think I need a drink.

speaker: Jerry
text: Me, too.

speaker: Barney
text: Glen McKenna, neat.

text: Milk, skim.

text: Milk? Oh, you're taking it easy. Crazy night?

speaker: Jerry
text: I'll say. Between you and me, I had a lot of acid last night.

speaker: Barney
text: Wow.

text: I think it was the chili dog. I had to take four Tums. I was up till, like, 9:30.

speaker: Barney
text: Hey, um.. When I was a kid, you used to be a roadie. You still do that?

speaker: Jerry
text: No. I switched lanes years ago. I should explain. I'm a driving instructor. Now you get it, right

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah, no, I get it. Um, but when I was a kid, you... you were this total badass.

speaker: Jerry
text: Oh, I know. I was a real hard partier.

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah, okay, now we're getting to the good stuff.

speaker: Jerry
text: The drugs, the alcohol, the women...

speaker: Barney
text: Yes, yes, yes.

speaker: Jerry
text: I was out of control.

speaker: Barney
text: *Out of control.*

speaker: Jerry
text: So when your mom said I couldn't see you any more, it was rock bottom for me. I'm so sorry.

speaker: Barney
text: You ever bang Stevie Nicks?

speaker: Jerry
text: Barney wasn't interested in my apology. He just wanted me to be cool. And I was so desperate to connect with him. I did something I'm not proud of. I started bragging.

speaker: Jerry
text: I bet you didn't know this about me, Barney, but I've published two nonfiction books about asparagus. And one fiction. I'm credited with inventing the word "furgling." It means fumbling for keys. So then all the county fair judges started chanting, "More quiche! More quiche!" I guess you could call me the LeBron James of drapes.

speaker: Jerry
text: I could tell he just wanted me to be this big ladies' man, so...

speaker: Jerry
text: What a hottie, huh? I'm sure you're a real player.

speaker: Barney
text: Big-time.

speaker: Jerry
text: Observe. Excuse me, that's my son over there. I'm trying to reconnect with him after 30 years. Would you just write down any seven numbers here, so that I can impress him? Please, I'm desperate.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, my God, you're a natural. Think of the pickup plays we can run as a father-son duo. There's the "Father Knows Breast," there's the "Bush Dynasty," the "Lick Father, Lick Son."

speaker: Jerry
text: Oh, no, no. I couldn't do that.

speaker: Barney
text: Why?

speaker: Jerry
text: I have a family now. That's my wife Cheryl, my daughter Carly... she's in college. This is my son J.J. I was hoping you could come over to dinner sometime and meet them.

speaker: Barney
text: You're all wearing matching sweaters. That's cute. Look, I got to get going, Jerry. But, uh, this was great. Glad we did this.

speaker: Jerry
text: I made him wait all these years for me and... I'm just not the guy he wanted me to be. I know I don't deserve it, but... I need another chance to connect with my son.

speaker: Lily
text: We think you should give him another chance. That's the real reason we're out here. He lives ten minutes away.

speaker: Barney
text: What?

speaker: Marshall
text: You're having dinner with him tonight.

text: No, I most certainly am not. Look, I met him. He's not my kind of bro and that's that.

text: Guys, get it through your heads. I am never gonna talk to my dad again.

text: No, Barney. I'm never gonna talk to my dad again. But your dad is alive and he lives just down the road.

speaker: Marshall
text: Awesome. Um, Lily, keys. (She throws them way too hard, they land in the trees) I'm literally 11 inches from you.
Ted from 2030: And so Barney agreed to give his dad one more chance.

text: Hello. You must be Barney. I'm Cheryl. It's just so nice to finally meet you. I love that suit.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, thank you very much. And I love your...coat. I love your coat.

text: Well, I do love it. It's doing a nice job covering up that chair.

text: Yikes! I'm surrounded by a bunch of dum-dums. Good thing I don't have any gaps in my knowledge. I am perfect. Oh, for the love of God, guys, enough already.

text: What, baby?

text: You've been treating me with kid gloves ever since my dad died.

text: I'm sorry.

text: Hey, Lily, (his voice cracks) Can you get me a mojito? Normally, you would've given me crap for an hour about a voice crack that pubescently girl-like, but nothing. So then I started to test you guys. [...] The Phantom Menace is by far the best Star Wars movie.

text: It ages well, that's the thing.

text: And once I figured it out, I started doing crazy stuff to see how far you'd let me go. [...]Hey, guys. This is Rex. He's a possum. I found him in the trash. He lives with us now.

text: I love him.

text: Lily, we are living with a possum. Rex is violent and he hates us.

text: But, baby, you just lost your dad. None of us wants to upset you.

speaker: Marshall
text: Please. If you guys really want me to get over the worst tragedy of my life, I'm begging you, tear me a new one. But not like Rex tried to in my sleep last night.

speaker: Jerry
text: J.J., dinner. When I got your letter, I dug this up. You were probably too young to remember, but this is you, this is me, and, of course, ZZ Top.

text: Don't you think that maybe we should go home and, uh, "do the laundry"

text: Yeah, I do. I make a ton of money. How much do you make, J.J.?

text: Jerry!

text: Oh, okay, Barney. Uh, maybe that's enough.

text: This is mine.

text: J.J. gets a childhood, a dad, a real family and a basketball hoop? No, no. I at least get the hoop. I'm taking it with me.

text: Please, just come down and talk to me.

text: Why does that make you so mad?

speaker: Jerry

text: I know, I know, I know! I want to fix this, and I don't know how! Please, tell me what I can do! I'll do anything! You're never gonna get it down like that. Barney. Barney! Just put the pointy end into the grooves. That's it. Now turn it. Righty tighty, lefty loosey. I have no good excuse, Barney. It took me years before I was even able to look myself in the mirror for the way I let you down. It took courage to send me that letter. More courage than I've ever had. I owe you a lifetime of apologies, and I... I just have no idea where to begin.

speaker: Barney
text: Can you help me with this?

speaker: Jerry
text: Here, got it. Look, if you... ever feel like you're ready, I'd love nothing more than to be a part of your life.

Ted from 2030: Kids, as you know, I was designing Goliath National Bank's new headquarters on the site of this old hotel, The Arcadian. Problem was, some people didn't want The Arcadian torn down. Even bigger problem, they were led by my girlfriend Zoey.

speaker: Crowd
text: G-N-B is the e-ne-my!

speaker: Zoey
text: (She sees Ted at the window) Oh, hang on, hang on, hang on! Hey, sweetie! Are we still on for dinner at 8:00 at Valenzisi's? That's great! I can't wait!

speaker: Crowd
text: That's great. I can't wait! That's great. I can't wait!
Ted from 2030: But somehow, Zoey and I were making it work.

speaker: Barney
text: Ted, why are you dating our arch-enemy?! I mean, Wile E. Coyote wasn't trying to sleep with the Roadrunner.

speaker: Robin
text: Or maybe he was. Think about it. The way that she bats her eyelashes and shakes her tail feathers in his face? (chuckles) She wants it.

speaker: Lily
text: Isn't it hard for you guys to be on opposite sides of something like this?

speaker: Ted
text: Of course you feel that way, Lily. You and Marshall have basically melded into one big hermaphroditic blob. And that's fine for you guys. But some of us want a partner who challenges us to grow and evolve.

speaker: Lily
text: You guys are in screaming matches all the time.

speaker: Ted
text: Uh-uh, uh-uh, uh-uh. Growing matches.
Ted from 2030: It was true. Zoey and I loved to challenge each other.

speaker: Ted
text: The main character is a young spoiled prince thrust into leadership after the death of his father. It's obviously a modern-day retelling of Henry IV!
Zoey:Are you kidding me?! It's Don Quixote...the classic quest story with the hero-jester and his long-suffering manservant!

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, clearly, when we're watching Tommy Boy, we're watching two different movies.

speaker: Ted
text: No, you hang up.

speaker: Zoey
text: No, you hang up.

speaker: Ted
text: No, you hang up.

speaker: Zoey
text: No, you hang up.

speaker: Ted
text: No, you hang up! (Later) No, you hang up.

text: No, you hang up.

text: No, you... (His phone starts beeping) Hold on. (beep) Hello?

speaker: Robin
text: For the love of God, will one of you idiots hang up the phone?

speaker: Ted
text: Why would you do that?!
Zoey:I-I thought you'd like it.

speaker: Ted
text: Who likes that?
Zoey:I like it.

speaker: Lily
text: Your relationship sounds exhausting.

speaker: Ted
text: Well, maybe yours is a bit lazy.

speaker: Lily
text: Marshall and I have been together 15 years, and the only debate we've had about Tommy Boy is whether it's awesome or super awesome. That's love, bitch.
Ted from 2030: Now around this time, Marshall had truly come to hate his job. He hated the paperwork. He hated the coffee. He hated the dirty jokes. He hated everything.

speaker: Marshall
text: I have to quit.

speaker: Barney
text: Quit GNB?! Why?

speaker: Marshall
text: I need to do better things with my life, okay? There's-There's an opening for an environmental lawyer at the National Resources Defense Council. Sure, it pays less, but I'd be saving the oceans, saving endangered species...

speaker: Barney
text: Saving chicken bones and an old boot to make hobo soup? Marshall, you can't pay your mortgage with Hacky Sacks and good vibes.

speaker: Lily
text: Baby, you have my full support.

speaker: Barney
text: Well, then, you're not going to be able to pay for that trip to Spain that you've been planning. (Barney snickers) Say good-bye to riding around in gondolas, and eating bratwurst and seeing the pyramids.
Robin:I don't think you know what Spain is.

speaker: Barney
text: Well, I know that a trip there costs some serious lira.

speaker: Ted
text: It's dinero.

speaker: Barney
text: Where? I want his autograph!

Ted from 2030: So Marshall walked in the next morning all ready to quit. But then something weird happened. Suddenly, he didn't hate the paperwork. He didn't hate the coffee. He didn't even hate the dirty jokes. Out of nowhere, Marshall actually liked GNB.

speaker: Robin
text: It's graduation goggles.

speaker: Marshall
text: What?

Robin:Graduation goggles, like with high school. It's four years of bullies making fun of all the kids with braces, even after the braces come off and they can walk just fine. But then, on graduation day, you suddenly get all misty because you realize you're never going to see those jerks again. I just had graduation goggles with that guy Scooby I dated.

speaker: Lily
text: The guy who was basically a dog?
Robin:He was the worst kisser I've ever been with. But the moment I decided to dump him...I suddenly got kind of wistful. (as speaking to a dog): He was a good boy.

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah. I've been there, too. Every time I'm done having s*x with a woman, at first,I never want to see her again. No, that's pretty much it.

Robin:The point is, you can't trust graduation goggles. They're just as misleading as beer goggles, bridesmaid goggles, and that's-just-a-bulky, outdated-cell-phone in-his-front-pocket goggles. That one was a bummer.

speaker: Marshall
text: You're right. Tomorrow, I'm quitting GNB.

speaker: Barney
text: No! You can't quit tomorrow! The lady with the big nipples is coming back to give another sexual harassment seminar, and I bribed one of the maintenance guys to keep the room at a brisk 55 degrees!

speaker: Lily
text: Baby, more than ever, you have my full support. (Lily and Marshall kisses)

speaker: Lily
text: I'm starting to feel bad for Ted and Zoey.

text: It starts with an... "L?"

text: How can you not remember my name?

text: It's like they never challenge each other. They just automatically agree all the time.

text: Well, they don't do that all the time.

text: No, they don't.

text: ... don't see eye-to-eye on anything! Totally.

speaker: Girl
text: It rhymes with your name.

speaker: Barney
text: And I said my name was...?

text: Baby, I did it! I quit. And then I walked right over to the NRDC, and I took that job.

text: Oh, good for you, sweetie.

text: Yeah. It's a little less money than I was expecting. I mean, compared to what I was making at GNB, it's nothing. Actually compared to anything, it's nothing. It's nothing. The paid position just got filled, so all I can do is-is volunteer right now. You're cool with that, right?

text: Baby, if this is what you need to do, we'll figure it out. How's Barney handling you leaving?

text: Hey, Barney, there's a bunch of models in the lobby, and the gossip is one of them is really a dude. You want to play "Who's Hot and Who's Scott?"

text: It's always the one in the turtleneck, Ted. And no, I don't want to play. Stupid Marshall-... ruined everything.

text: Guys, everything's ruined.

text: What? Why?

speaker: Man
text: Your girlfriend somehow got the Landmark Preservation Committee to agree to a hearing. If they declare the Arcadian a landmark, the whole project is dead. The good news is, I just got the phone number of a husky-voiced hottie in a turtleneck.
Robin:...so, if the Landmarks Preservation Committee sides with Zoey, your whole project goes down the tubes? You must be furious.

speaker: Ted
text: I'm furiously enjoying being challenged.

speaker: Lily
text: Why don't you admit that your girlfriend challenging your every move is getting you a little murder-suicidey?

speaker: Ted
text: Why don't you admit that Marshall quitting his job and taking an unpaid internship is killing you?

speaker: Lily
text: It's not.

speaker: Ted
text: Lily, the downside to having giant, Japanese anime eyes is that they're easy to read. And yours are screaming, "What about my trip to Spain, deadbeat?"

speaker: Lily
text: Okay, Ted, the downside to having a woman's mouth is, your feminine pout gives away your true feelings. And yours is saying, "Oh, Zoey, why can't I be on top just this once?"

speaker: Ted
text: We take turns! Sometimes.

speaker: Marshall
text: Hey, guys. Thanks. Hey. I just had the best first day at the NRDC.

speaker: Barney
text: I'm sorry. Sorry. Something Hershel said at work today.

speaker: Robin
text: Hershel?

speaker: Barney
text: What, don't you guys know Hershel? Didn't I tell you? Oh, he's the new lawyer who replaced Marshall at GNB. He is so awesome and funny and tall... taller than Marshall... and he knows way more laws.

speaker: Lily
text: Well, I'm glad you like your new co-worker.

speaker: Barney
text: There's no Hershel! I was just saying that to make you jealous! Why do you insist we play these games?

speaker: Marshall
text: Barney, I'm not playing...

speaker: Barney
text: Just come back to GNB already!

speaker: Marshall
text: I'm really loving my new job.

speaker: Lily
text: Oh, and I'm loving seeing you this happy.

speaker: Marshall
text: I'm so glad to hear you say that because I volunteered our apartment for a big NRDC fund-raiser tomorrow night. You're-You're cool with that, right?

speaker: Lily
text: Baby, you have my full support.

speaker: Marshall
text: Thanks, baby. (phone chirps) Oh. Ooh, I gotta go. The invitations are ready. The party's for a bunch of environmentalists, so I found a guy downtown who makes biodegradable party invitations that can also be used as toilet paper.

speaker: Barney
text: That's how I'm gonna use mine.

speaker: Robin
text: Why in the world do you care so much whether Marshall works at GNB?

speaker: Barney
text: Care? I don't care. I'm like, whatever. Marshall who? He's stupid. Hershel's way better.
Robin:Okay, Barney, is it possible that with everything that's gone on with your dad lately, you might have some unresolved abandonment issues you're transferring onto Marshall?

speaker: Barney
text: Oh! Ugh! You are worse than my shrink. "Barney, we have to talk about your father." "Barney, I'm not going to teach you how to hypnotize people. You'll only use it for evil." "Barney, I am not going to conduct a couples session "between you and this woman. She's obviously a prostitute." I don't need this!

speaker: Ted
text: Ah, Lily Aldrin, half of the world's most perfect couple! I was thinking about that woman's mouth comment, and I have three good comebacks. One: your mom didn't seem to mind it last night on her...

speaker: Lily
text: Okay, look, Ted, I need a favor. Would you mind driving out to Kennedy with me to pick up this famous ecologist for Marshall's fund-raiser? Apparently, he only speaks Spanish. And you speak Spanish, right? (Ted says something in spanish) Perfect. Let's go.

speaker: Barney
text: Hey, Marshall, it's me. Listen, I know I've been kind of a jerk about your leaving GNB. I just wanted to call and say I'm sorry. No apologies necessary. We're good. Good. Um, hey, any chance you might maybe... I don't know... if you're not busy, uh, want to have lunch today?

speaker: Marshall
text: Oh, buddy, I'd love to, but I can't.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, that's cool. No biggie. Another time.

speaker: Robin
text: (Robin is standing at the door) Oh, my God!

speaker: Barney
text: How long have you been there?

speaker: Robin
text: You don't remember?

speaker: Robin
text: Hey. I was in the neighborhood. I just wanted to check in on you. You seemed, um, you seemed really upset the other day.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, no, I'm fine.

speaker: Robin
text: Okay. Well, um, you want to go grab some lunch?
Barney:Sure. Hey, are you okay if I invite Marshall to join us?

speaker: Robin
text: Yeah.
Barney:Right. So, um... Chinese?

speaker: Ted
text: You know, just because Zoey and I are a different kind of couple than you and Marshall doesn't make us a worse couple.

speaker: Lily
text: You're right. I-If you and Zoey are happy, then who am I to judge? I'm so sorry.

speaker: Ted
text: Oh, my God, is that how support feels? It's so warm and wonderful. Oh, Lily, I've been so unhappy.

speaker: Lily
text: But I thought you liked being challenged.

speaker: Ted
text: Nobody likes being challenged! Couldn't she agree with me just once, even on something little, like... like what movie to see or-or what topping to get on our pizza or... oh, I don't know, my lifelong dream of building a skyscraper in New York City?!

speaker: Lily
text: Well, in her defense, hamburger pizza, Ted? What are you, 12?

speaker: Ted
text: You were right, Lily. I mean, Zoey's great, but... sometimes I do wish we were a little more like you and Marshall. There he is. Here we go. (Ted says some incomprehensible things in spanish)

text: I'm sorry. I don't speak... whatever it is you're speaking.

text: Um, he speaks perfect English.

text: You were right. If I hear myself say "Baby, you have my full support" one more time, I swear I'm gonna m*rder someone!

speaker: Lily
text: I've never been good at that. And now, ever since his dad died, I-I feel like it's my job to just be fine with everything. But I'm not. I'm not fine that he volunteers our apartment for a giant fund-raiser and that he's not thinking about how we're gonna pay any of our bills and that, apparently, we've given up on trying to have kids.

speaker: Ted
text: Lil...

speaker: Lily

text: You trashed your office today. I mean, you obviously have some deep feelings you're not confronting. And I think they're about your dad.

text: Because I don't. And why am I explaining this to you? You're the most secretive person I know. You never tell anybody anything.

speaker: Robin
text: I've never... told anyone this before. Um... I was 16. I was awakened around midnight by the sound of my father arguing with his business partner, Andy Grenier. As things grew heated... I watched my father's hand slowly coil around the heavy antique clock on his desk. The sun was just starting to rise over the bramble orchard as we packed the fresh earth down with the flats of our shovels. My dad and I got our stories straight. We walked back to the house in silence and... haven't talked about it since. But sometimes... on a still night... you can still hear that clock, ticking... ticking... (quietly): ticking.

speaker: Barney
text: That's... the most harrowing story I've ever heard. Is it true?

speaker: Robin
text: No. But it did get you to drink three scotches, which is why you're ready to spill your guts.

text: Fine! The reason I'm upset about Marshall leaving GNB is... is...the meatball sub.

text: Huh?

speaker: Barney
text: It all started months ago in the GNB commissary. It was Meatball Sub Day.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, how I used to love Meatball Sub Day. And then, the most humiliating moment of my life.

speaker: Marshall
text: Hey, buddy, I think you got a tiny little bit of marinara sauce on your tie there.

speaker: Barney
text: I plotted my revenge for weeks. But nothing seemed right. Then it hit me. The answer was so elegant and simple-- an exploding meatball sub. For months, I experimented. More... marinara sauce. Finally, the sub was perfected. The plan was in place. The snare was baited. And then...

Barney:...he quit, Robin, he quit! It's Meatball Sub Day today, which is why I wanted Marshall to come over and have lunch. But no. All that work wasted. (quiet sobbing) You want to make God laugh, tell him your plans, right?

text: What is wrong with you?

text: Hey, Professor Rodriguez, thank you so much for coming.
Prof. Rodriguez: Oh, my pleasure. I have to use the restroom. Do you have some extra invitations?

text: Marshall, hey. Sorry, I, uh, I had to park and-and grab some ice. Sorry.

text: Oh, thanks, babe. You would not believe how much this one has done to help throw this party, Ted. I don't know how she does it. Can't be easy, huh, Lil?

speaker: Lily
text: Yeah. Listen, Marshall, I-I need to talk to you about something.

speaker: Marshall
text: No, you know what? Me, too. Um... I want to thank you for being so supportive of me in all this. I've been at the NRDC for less than a week, and I've already done more to be proud of than in two years at GNB. I can't believe how good it feels. But now, it's time for me to find a way to help the Earth and get paid for it, because I can't put that burden entirely on you. So, starting tomorrow, I'll look for something with a paycheck. What do you think?

speaker: Lily
text: Baby, you have my full support.

speaker: Zoey
text: Ted.

text: Hey! What are you doing here?

text: I have the chance to build a skyscraper in the best city on Earth, and who's the one leading the charge to k*ll that dream? My girlfriend!

speaker: Zoey
text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. What about my lifelong dream of not seeing every beautiful building in Manhattan bulldozed?

Ted from 2030: And in that moment, I realized, though I really cared about Zoey, I couldn't do this for the next 50 years. I had to break up with her. But then... Kids, some couples always support each other, and some couples always challenge each other, but is one really better than the other? Yes. Support is better. Way better. But I'd have to learn that the hard way.

Ted from 2030: Kids, this is a story of landmarks. There are certain moments in life when you have to decide which things you can stand to see torn down, and which things you have to preserve, no matter what. Such a moment came for all of us in May of 2011, at a special meeting of the New York City Landmarks Preservation Commission, where the fate of The Arcadian would be decided once and for all.

speaker: Marshall
text: A symbol of strength and constancy, the stone lion of The Arcadian has watched over New Yorkers for generations. So remember: if the lion head stonework is regal, then tearing it down should be illegal. Well. Did you like that? All right, uh... We must make sure the lion is always there. Destroy The Arcadian? text: "Yes. The Arcadian should be a landmark." And then the crowd gasps: "Oh, my God! Did he really just say that? Oh, heavens! Oh, my stars! I must clutch my pearls!"

speaker: Zoey
text: So these things are generally attended by old Southern ladies?

speaker: Ted
text: Almost exclusively. But here's my point: If they ask GNB's chief architect... aka me... if The Arcadian should be a landmark, and I say "yes"?

speaker: Zoey
text: That, no, that wasn't The Arcadian being destroyed; that was GNB's hopes of destroying The Arcadian.

speaker: Marshall
text: I'm sorry, I should have been more clear.

speaker: Zoey
text: Yeah. The Arcadian's gonna be all like...

speaker: Marshall
text: Nice.

speaker: Robin
text: I have a message from Barney.
Ted from 2030: Things between Barney and the rest of us had gotten a little frosty. First this happened.

speaker: Zoey
text: Meet the new lawyer I hired to help save The Arcadian.
Ted from 2030: And then this happened.

speaker: Zoey
text: What kind of dirtbag doesn't stand by his best friends, but instead, sides with some self-righteous bitch with a pointless cause and a megaphone?!

speaker: Ted
text: Dude! That's my girlfriend. And ya know what? I'm on her side now, too.
Ted from 2030: Which led to this happening.

speaker: Zoey
text: Message from Barney? That's my cue to leave. Good night, guys. I love you.

speaker: Ted
text: Mmm. Love you, too.

speaker: Lily
text: All right, what's the message? 'Cause if it's another hypothetical yet eerily accurate drawing of my boobs...

speaker: Robin
text: Yeah, I have that, too.

speaker: Lily
text: Damn it.

speaker: Robin
text: All right, here's the message. (clears throat, then reads Barney's note) "Oh, hey, guys. Didn't see you there. I was too busy feelin' fine and..." Really? "Feelin' fine and gettin' some 'jine. You may have noticed the giant plate of hot wings in front of me. I know how much you love hot wings. Too bad someone bribed the kitchen to take them off the menu tonight. So, if you want some, you're going to have to come back to GNB. But hurry, this offer will be gone lickety-split. (Barney licks his hot wings peace by peace then throws them down) Do evil laugh." Oh, um... (makes a poor impression of Barney's laugh) So, what are you turds up to?

speaker: Marshall
text: Oh, we've got the big LPC meeting in two days. I have my whole presentation worked out. I just need to find a good rhyme to end on.

speaker: Ted
text: Why does it need to rhyme?

speaker: Marshall
text: If you end an argument with a rhyme, it's convincing all the time.

speaker: Lily
text: Yeah. It's why in our apartment: If you're a-hopin' to score, don't leave your socks on the floor.

speaker: Marshall
text: And she hasn't since.

speaker: Barney
text: Okay, okay. A couple of things. Lily, how'd I do?

speaker: Marshall
text: Nailed it.

speaker: Barney
text: Secondly, Ted, I'm sorry I said mean things about Zoey. Are you really going to walk away from this project just because you're mad at me?

speaker: Ted
text: It's not because I'm mad at you. Barney, The Arcadian was designed by a guy named John Clifford Larrabee. And even though he's been dead for half a century, it's my duty, architect to architect, to keep his work alive. Please tell me a little part of you understands.

speaker: Barney
text: I understand. Zoey has magic lady bits.

speaker: Ted
text: What?

speaker: Barney
text: Zoey's lady bits... are magic, and that's how she controls your mind. You see, every few hundred millennia, lady bits leap forward...

speaker: Lily
text: I know you're only just getting started, but this is already gross.

speaker: Barney
text: I once knew such a girl.

speaker: Barney
text: It was last call. In this very bar.

speaker: Barney
text: What...?! No... What?!...No... What?!

speaker: Robin
text: Um... thank you for, um, not using a first name in that story.

speaker: Ted
text: Barney, this is about the building.

speaker: Barney
text: Come on. This is so about the girl.

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, fine. It's about the girl! I am doing this for Zoey! I'm in love with her. Look, I know it's early, but there is a very good chance Zoey might be the mother of my children. So, in addition to doing this for John Clifford Larrabee, I'm also doing this for Luke and Leia.

speaker: Lily
text: Wait. She's gonna let you name your kids Luke and Leia?

speaker: Ted
text: Not if I knock down her favorite building, she isn't. Barney, I'm sorry.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, you're not sorry now, Ted Mosby. But you will be. You... will... be. (laughing harder and louder) That's how you do an evil laugh. Ciao for now.
Ted from 2030: Now, kids, you remember Arthur Hobbs, Barney and Marshall's old boss at GNB? Well, Arthur was going through a divorce and taking it kind of hard.

speaker: Barney
text: Hi, Arthur. Everything okay?

speaker: Arthur
text: No, everything's not okay. My stupid wife got custody of Tugboat. God, I should have kept her hidden in a cage in the basement.

speaker: Barney
text: Isn't that animal cruelty?

speaker: Arthur
text: I'm talking about my wife.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh. That's fine, then. So listen, you know Ted, the architect?

speaker: Arthur
text: Yeah, I know your friend Ted.

speaker: Barney
text: So, if Ted stood up at that big meeting tomorrow and said that he thought The Arcadian should be a landmark... You wouldn't just fire him, would you? (laughing uncomfortably) Right? You wouldn't just... You wouldn't just... yeah...

speaker: Arthur
text: No, Barney. I wouldn't just fire him. I'd also fire you.

speaker: Barney
text: Come again for Big Fudge?

speaker: Barney
text: Can you believe that?! I can't be unemployed, Robin! My job is my identity; It's who I am. It gives me the confidence I need to convince girls I'm a fighter pilot.

speaker: Robin
text: I-I don't understand. Why would he fire you?

speaker: Barney
text: I don't understand. Why would you fire me?

speaker: Arthur
text: Have you already forgotten how Mosby got that job?

speaker: Barney
text: By being the best architect available?

speaker: Arthur
text: No.

speaker: Barney
text: By... being Latino?

speaker: Arthur
text: No. Let me refresh your memory. We were in this very room.

speaker: Barney
text: Guys, I'm telling you, if Ted Mosby isn't fantastic, fire me.

speaker: Barney
text: Damn it! I was kidding?

speaker: Barney
text: I'm not kidding! Oh, by the way, Arthur, uh, how are things with you and your wife?

speaker: Arthur
text: Really good. In fact, I just put all my assets in her name. Smartest thing I've ever done.

speaker: Both
text: Damn it!

speaker: Arthur
text: No, you'd better make sure Mosby doesn't screw up tomorrow. Because either that building is going down, or you're going down.

speaker: Ted
text: They're going to fire him? That sucks. He loves that job.

speaker: Marshall
text: And he's been doing it for years.

speaker: Lily
text: Okay, what does Barney do at GNB?

speaker: Ted
text: No idea.

speaker: Marshall
text: He has a lot of keys.

speaker: Robin
text: Okay, Ted, can you just please think about this before you...

speaker: Ted
text: There's nothing to think about. I-I can't lose Zoey. That's the only thing that matters to me right now.

speaker: Robin
text: Okay, Ted... you know I love Zoey. But, look, sometimes... I go play chess in the park. And the key to chess... Okay, I play online. But the key to chess... Okay, it's Angry Birds! But the key to Angry Birds is to always try to see every possible outcome. And to... hit some pigs with rocks or something. I don't know; I don't play. I can't get it to download. The point is, this thing with you and Zoey? I can see it going three possible ways. There's the first scenario.

speaker: Robin
text: The chairman asks you...

speaker: Chairman
text: Do you think The Arcadian should be a landmark?

speaker: Robin
text: You say...

speaker: Ted
text: No.

speaker: Robin
text: And Zoey dumps you on the spot.

speaker: Zoey
text: We're done here.

speaker: Robin
text: There's the second scenario.

speaker: Robin
text: The chairman asks you...

speaker: Chairman
text: Do you think The Arcadian should be a landmark?

speaker: Robin
text: You say...

speaker: Ted
text: Yes

speaker: Robin
text: And you're happy for, like, a second, until you realize the building you helped save has just become a monument to everything this woman made you give up, and you resent her for it, so much so, in fact, that you dump her.

speaker: Ted
text: We're done here.

speaker: Ted
text: You said there was a third scenario.

speaker: Robin
text: Right.

speaker: Robin
text: The chairman asks you...

speaker: Chairman
text: Do you think The Arcadian should be a landmark?

speaker: Robin
text: But before you can answer...You're hit in the neck with a blow dart fired by the ninja Zoey's ex-husband hired to assassinate you.

speaker: Robin
text: That one's less likely. What I'm saying... what I hate saying... is this. You and Zoey are gonna break up. But you can still save your career and Barney's.

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, first of all, no ninja's getting a jump on me. I have the reflexes of a jungle... (Robin slaps him by surprise)

speaker: Lily
text: Tree?

speaker: Ted
text: Second of all, I don't care that the odds are stacked against us. I'd rather try to make this work with Zoey than spend the rest of my life alone playing Angry Birds, which, by the way, I've shown you how to download, like, 20 times.

speaker: Lily
text: I've got to say, I'm with Ted on this.

speaker: Ted
text: Thank you.

speaker: Lily
text: I mean, yes, this is a huge, divisive issue for them. Which means no matter what happens, there's gonna be a lot of resentment. Probably lasting for years... infecting every single moment of the rest of their relationship. So, in conclusion, I'm with Robin on this.

speaker: Robin
text: Thank you.
Ted from 2030: That night, as I slept soundly...

speaker: Ted
text: Barney, what are you doing?

speaker: Ghost
text: Who is this Barney? My name is John Clifford Larrabee, architect of The Arcadian. And I am visiting you in a dream...

speaker: Ted
text: Really? 'Cause it feels more like my insane friend renting a costume and breaking into my apartment in the middle of the night for what I wish I could say was the first time.

speaker: Ghost
text: Look, it's a dream, it is. So just... okay? Theodore... heed my words: do not try to save The Arcadian.

speaker: Ted
text: Barney, there's condoms in the drawer. Just take them and get out.
Ghost, shouting dramatically: I am not... Barney...

speaker: Ted
text: Whoa! Lighting change!

speaker: Ghost
text: Theodore, you know The Arcadian is a badly built, architecturally unimportant rat's nest designed by an overpaid, plagiarizing ether addict with two thumbs. This guy.

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, yes, it's-it's a terrible building, but... does that mean we have to knock it down? I mean, it's not bothering anyone. Just anyone who lives in it... Or looks at it... Or smells it.

speaker: Ghost
text: New York is never finished, Theodore. She's a lady only a handful of architects ever get to dance with. Do not miss your turn.

speaker: Ted
text: The Arcadian has to go, doesn't it?

speaker: Ghost
text: Indeed.

speaker: Ted
text: You realize this kind of screws up my personal life.

speaker: Ghost
text: Mo' buildings, mo' problems.

speaker: Ted
text: This is a dream, right? Because, Barney, I swear to God, if that's you...

speaker: Ghost
text: Mommy's got Magic Lady Bits, Ted.
Ted, panting: Dream! Dream! It was just a dream. (He takes his breath again, then phones Zoey) Hey. I know it's late, but, uh... you want to meet up?

speaker: Zoey
text: Hello, Mr. Lion.

speaker: Ted
text: "Look on my works, ye mighty, and despair""

speaker: Zoey
text: Hey, I met you right...(laughs)...here.

speaker: Ted
text: Right. And I mistook you for a prostitute right... here.

speaker: Zoey
text: As far as you know, I still could be one. And you, my good man, have run up quite a tab.

speaker: Ted
text: Worth every penny.

speaker: Zoey
text: All right... this was fun. I'm gonna take this cab. Big day tomorrow. We need to get some sleep. And yet...

speaker: Ted
text: No, we should get some sleep. But this was fun.

speaker: Zoey
text: Yeah. It's nice getting one last look to remember what we're trying to save.

speaker: Ted
text: Exactly.

speaker: Zoey
text: You okay?

speaker: Ted
text: Yeah. Good night.

speaker: Chairman
text: Mr. Mosby, I'm going to ask you one last time. Should The Arcadian be a landmark?

speaker: Ted
text: No, it shouldn't be a landmark. There are a lot of important buildings in New York. The Arcadian isn't one of them.

speaker: Zoey
text: E-Excuse me, I have a question for Mr. Mosby. If he doesn't think The Arcadian's worth saving, then whose voice is this? (She plays a recorder)
Ted, on recorder: The Arcadian should be a landmark. It should. The lion head stonework is iconic. I hate working for GNB. They're a bunch of... wieners and gonads.

speaker: Chairman
text: Is that your voice, Mr. Mosby?

speaker: Ted
text: Yeah, that's me.

speaker: Ted
text: This is a nightmare. I can't believe she kept that tape. The LPC's gonna come back with a decision tomorrow, and based on today...

speaker: Robin
text: They're gonna landmark the hell out of that place.

speaker: Ted
text: Yeah.

speaker: Barney
text: We'll end up out of a job, all thanks to some stupid, only sort of awesome lion head.

speaker: Marshall
text: Better get used to that lion head. As of tomorrow, it's gonna be there till the end of times. And all because of my sweet, sweet rhymes.

speaker: Ted
text: What are we gonna do? We should buy a bar.

speaker: Barney
text: We should totally buy a bar!

speaker: Marshall
text: We should absolutely totally buy a bar!

speaker: Robin
text: It's really the only sensible idea right now.

speaker: Marshall
text: Oh, oh, and ready? It's a theme bar. It's a courtroom.

speaker: Ted
text: Yes! Where the bartenders wear sexy judges' robes.

speaker: Marshall
text: I'll allow it!

speaker: Barney
text: The only court where you show up, then get served.

speaker: Robin
text: Ho! You're judged by a jury of your beers.

speaker: Ted
text: That's not bad.

speaker: Lily
text: Just stop it! No one's buying a bar. Right now we have a little problem. Let's just think of a solution.

speaker: Ted
text: Lily, it's over. The good guys lost.

speaker: Marshall
text: I don't know, homegirl is pretty diabolical. If there is a plan that'll get us out of this, it's somewhere inside this butter churn. She'll think of it. I'm just gonna sit here... and watch it happen. (Lily starts to jiggle) And she's got it! Lily, what's the plan?

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, this ought to be good.
Ted from 2030: And then Lily told us her plan.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, this is good!

speaker: Ted
text: We have to find Arthur right now.

speaker: Arthur
text: What is so difficult about this?! Tugboat figured this out in, like, five minutes. This is bush league!

speaker: Barney
text: Hey, Arthur!

speaker: Robin
text: Oh, cute dog!

speaker: Arthur
text: No! Tugboat, my other dog, that was a cute dog. This little disappointment is nothing but a cheap facsimile. I said it! Yeah, my love is reserved for dogs that go to the bathroom on command instead of wasting my time!

speaker: Barney
text: Listen, Arthur, Marshall's wife has an idea for how we can save, not saving The Arcadian.

speaker: Arthur
text: Oh, his wife has an idea. Let me tell you about wives, okay? They leave you and take your best friend with them. You're not Tugboat! You'll never be Tugboat!

speaker: Barney
text: Uh... Hey, Arthur?

speaker: Arthur
text: I guess this one's kind of cute or whatever. So... so what's the idea?

speaker: Lily
text: Okay, first hear my demands. One, Ted and Barney keep their jobs. Two, when you guys do finally blow up The Arcadian, one of them gets to push the button.

speaker: Barney and Ted
text: Dibs.

speaker: Arthur
text: Fine! What's the idea?

speaker: Lily
text: Well...
Ted from 2030: Kids, for legal reasons, I have to skip this part of the story and jump ahead to the next night, as the Landmarks Preservation Commission gave their verdict.

speaker: Chairman
text: Last night, this committee took a vote, and while we have all felt from the very beginning that The Arcadian is, well, an eyesore... Mr. Mosby's surprising testimony about the lion's head stonework left us no choice but to declare it... a landmark. But then, something else happened last night. That same lion's head stonework...disappeared. So... that makes our job a little easier. Motion denied.

speaker: Ted
text: Zoey... Zoey!

speaker: Zoey
text: All right, what do you have to say for yourself?

speaker: Ted
text: I don't know. Sometimes... things have to fall apart to make way for better things.

speaker: Zoey
text: We're done here.

speaker: Ted
text: Okay, you don't have to hold back anymore. You may now say what you really think of Zoey.

speaker: Barney
text: I don't know, she may have been right about that lion's head. It gave The Arcadian a regal elegance. Then again, it goes really nice with my duvet. (He takes out a normal size screw driver) I hope I used the right screws.

Ted from 2030: Kids, in the spring of 2011, Zoey and I broke up. But the good news: Goliath National Bank was finally ready to demolish The Arcadian and build the new headquarters I'd designed for them. (A committee, including Ted holding a big pair of scissors, is standing behind a red ruban. Ted is going to cut it, when a very happy Barney arrives with a bigger pair of scissors and cut the ruban before Ted can) The only problem was... I kept butting heads with my project supervisor on one very important issue.

speaker: Ted
text: I want to press the button to blow up The Arcadian!

speaker: Barney
text: I want to press it!

speaker: Ted
text: I want to press it!

speaker: Barney
text: I want to press it!

speaker: Robin
text: Guys, I dated you both, and neither of you is good at pressing or even finding the button. After some awkward pawing around, that building's going to fake an implosion, say, "Baby, that was great"" and go to sleep.
Both Ted and Barney, at the same time: She means you. I want to press it! I'm gonna press it!

speaker: Robin
text: It's just a button, okay? Can we just talk about something else, please?

speaker: Ted
text: Well, I ran into Zoey yesterday.

speaker: Robin
text: That's the first time since the breakup. How's she doing?

speaker: Zoey
text: I'm still unemployed, so I had to get a couple roommates.

speaker: Ted
text: Saving money. Making new friends. No downside.

speaker: Zoey
text: They're all 22 and sell drugs. Which means they're not taking them. So, that's a win.

speaker: Ted
text: Well, I can tell you're really busy so I should... I'll let you go.

speaker: Zoey
text: Hey. You want to get coffee sometime?

speaker: Robin
text: You know that "coffee" is code for "I want to get back together" right?

speaker: Ted
text: Well, at first I wasn't sure, but then she said something that got me thinking.

speaker: Zoey
text: I want to get back together.

speaker: Ted
text: Don't worry, we're not. I just, I feel bad Zoey's having such a hard time.

speaker: Barney
text: You know what might... make you feel better, buddy?

speaker: Ted
text: I'm not letting you press the button.

speaker: Barney
text: I want to press the button!

speaker: Ted
text: You're not pressing the button! It's my button!
Ted from 2030: Sadly, that's all you need to know about my summer. Now, around this time, Uncle Marshall was still having a tough time finding a job.

speaker: Lily
text: He's out printing out a whole new batch of résumés because he misspelled the phrase "detail-oriented." And when he gets back home, he is going to find his favorite soup there waiting for him.

speaker: Robin
text: Oh, that's sweet, Lil, but didn't you guys get food poisoning here one time?

speaker: Lily
text: Three times. But they're really nice about it. Their policy is, "Get sick, get a free gallon of soup".
Ted from 2030: And so, Lily dropped off Marshall's surprise soup and headed back to work to introduce the new class pet.

speaker: Lily
text: This is Mr. Buttons 2. Now, after what happened to Mr. Buttons 1, we have to be very gentle with... (Lily throws up onto Mr. Buttons 2. She leaves the shool, running to her apartment in order to stop Marshall from eating the soup) Marshall! Don't eat the soup! Oh, thank God.

speaker: Marshall
text: This was about to be my third bowl. Why shouldn't I eat the soup? Why shouldn't I eat the soup?

speaker: Robin
text: Hey, Mr. Architect, big day for you tomorrow, huh?

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah. Getting to stand next to me while I press the button. That is going to be legend... wait for it...dary adjacent. Legendary adjacent!

speaker: Robin
text: You okay?

speaker: Ted
text: Yeah... no. This morning I was talking to the foreman.

speaker: Foreman
text: Hey, hotshot.

speaker: Ted
text: You know, Rod, um, I'm loving that nickname, and I can tell it's totally affectionate, but, uh, I'd prefer Ted.

speaker: Rod
text: Yeah, but you're such a hotshot, I figured I'd just call you hotshot. Pick one. And make sure you like it. There's going to be 50,000 of these in your big, hotshot building, hotshot.

speaker: Ted
text: 50,000 lightbulbs! What if this one's too bright? What if this one flickers and gives everyone a weird headache? Do you know how many people it takes to change 50,000 lightbulbs?

speaker: Barney
text: Are these people Irish, Polish, blondes... what are we dealing with here?

speaker: Ted
text: There's just-- there's so many decisions to be made. What if I make all the wrong ones and my building just sucks?

speaker: Barney
text: Not possible. Your building is new. And I have one rule: New is always better.

speaker: Ted
text: You can't keep saying you have one rule if they're always different rules.

speaker: Barney
text: Ah, but "new is always better" is my oldest rule, which makes it the best.

speaker: Ted
text: Hi, Marsh.

speaker: Barney
text: Oh, hey, buddy.

speaker: Robin
text: Hey. Everything okay?

speaker: Marshall
text: Lily got food poisoning from some soup. And then I ate the soup exactly three hours later. Which means I can see exactly three hours into my future, and it... doesn't... look... good. I tried to be supportive.

speaker: Lily
text: Oh, baby, can you just hold me, please?

speaker: Marshall
text: Of course, baby. (He hesitates, then put one finger onto her back)

speaker: Marshall
text: But it doesn't help it that when Lily gets going; she sounds like a velociraptor from Jurassic Park. But then I realized a man can do a lot of living in three hours. So, I'm out experiencing this beautiful, crazy dance called life. Ah, my last meal. MacClaren's famous jalapeno poppers. My doctor says I need to eat healthier, so I figured the round-trip flight these babies are about to take will land them permanently on the no-fry list. Good-bye, my friend. It's been a hell of a ride. I have to...

speaker: Marshall
text: Hey, babe. The gang says feel better.

speaker: Lily
text: Mm. Thanks. Wait, you didn't tell them I had food poisoning, did you?

speaker: Marshall
text: Um, I...

speaker: Lily
text: Marshall, when it's stomach stuff, you just say "under the weather," or people start picturing you doing unspeakable things.

speaker: Marshall
text: I know. I just said that you had the sniffles. No one is picturing anything but little red-nosed you under a blankie with some hot tea.

speaker: Barney
text: I wonder what end it's coming out of Lily right now.

speaker: Robin
text: I bet it's her tushie.

speaker: Barney
text: I bet it's both. Hey, speaking of explosions... enough already, Ted! That button's mine!
Ted, while texting on his phone: Yeah, fine, okay.

speaker: Barney
text: I got you this job, so I... Say what?

speaker: Ted
text: Whatever. It's yours. I gotta run. (Ted leaves the Bar)

speaker: Barney
text: You...

Marshall, picking up his phone: Hello?... Yes, it is. (To Lily) It's Bloom, Greenberg and Associates. They want me to come interview. (Lily throws up) I know it's risky to go, but this is the best environmental law firm in New York. It's my dream job. (Lily throws up) That's a great idea, babe. I'll ask them. (In his phone) Hey, is it at all possible, could I come in on Monday?... Okay, I'll, I'll see you at 5:00. (Marshall hangs up) Thank you. I love and believe in you, too, baby.

speaker: Robin
text: Why would Ted just give up the button like that? And he forgot his phone. "See you in an hour."

speaker: Barney
text: Who's that from?

speaker: Robin
text: Zoey. They're meeting for coffee. Ted's getting back together with her!

speaker: Barney
text: Why would Ted get back together with Zoey? He's doing great.

speaker: Robin
text: After a breakup, we all think we're doing great. Sometimes the tiniest trigger can unravel you and send you crawling right back.

speaker: Barney
text: No, I refuse to believe that Ted is getting back with Zoey because of lightbulbs.

speaker: Robin
text: Uh, Ted's gone back for less.

speaker: Ted
text: Hi, Natalie. You want to get coffee sometime?

speaker: Ted
text: Bro.

speaker: Barney
text: Ted, I only have one rule.

speaker: Ted
text: But I can't reach the worst part. (He picks his phone and calls someone) Hi, Karen. Want to get coffee sometime?

speaker: announcer
text: Coming up next, our two local pandas, Ming Ming and Bao Bao, are expecting a baby.

speaker: Ted
text: Robin, you want to get coffee sometime...?

speaker: Robin
text: Get it together, bro.

speaker: Marshall
text: According to my calculations, at 6:00 p.m., my body is gonna pay out like the most disgusting slot machine in the world. That gives me two hours to go do the interview and still get back in time.

speaker: Lily
text: Oh, but, baby, what if you hit the jackpot early?

speaker: Marshall
text: Don't worry. I'll be prepared.

speaker: Neighbor
text: I'm talking your ear off, sorry. Is there anything I can do for you, sweetie?

speaker: Marshall
text: Can... I... borrow... an adult diaper?

speaker: Barney
text: We've got to stop Ted. Where are they meeting?

speaker: Robin
text: Okay, Zoey wrote, "Meet me at 6:00, where it all began, where you gave me the orchid at the intersection."

speaker: Barney
text: Well, that's good. All we have to do is think back to the time Ted told us about his first date with Zoey.

speaker: Ted
text: Amazing first date with Zoey! We met at the intersection... (The rest is unintelligible)

speaker: Robin
text: Aw, that's sweet.

speaker: Barney
text: You weren't listening either?

speaker: Robin
text: I was in a coma. I mean, who pays attention to that sappy romantic crap?

speaker: Barney and Robin
text: Lily!

speaker: Lily
text: Yeah, I wasn't listening, either. Ted really can go on about a bitch.

speaker: Robin
text: Great. He could be anywhere. We're flat out of clues.

speaker: Lily
text: Hey, wait. Ted left a message. I could hear it 'cause I was in the bathroom... blowing my nose... I have the sniffles.

speaker: Ted's voice
text: Hey, Lily, hope you're feeling better. Marshall told us you're exploding from both ends like a busted fire hydrant.

speaker: Lily
text: Damn it, Marshall.

speaker: Ted's voice
text: Anyway, listen, I was going to get back together with Zoey today, but I came to my senses on the way out here, so... False alarm... Oh, crap. Just stepped in some gum. I'm getting back together with Zoey!

speaker: Robin
text: Okay, we're never gonna find him.

speaker: Lily
text: Wait, wait, wait. That's was a subway announcement in the background. I speak conductor.

speaker: voice
text: Hey, Lily, hope you're feeling better. Marshall told us...

speaker: Lily
text: Got it. Ted's at... (Lily runs to the bathroom and throws up) Oh... Ted's at Smith and Ninth Street.

speaker: Barney
text: That's the intersection.

speaker: Robin
text: That's in Brooklyn. How are we ever gonna get there in time?

speaker: Barney
text: Way ahead of ya.

speaker: Ranjit
text: Hello!

speaker: Man
text: Marshall. Jake Bloom. Great to meet you.

speaker: Marshall
text: Hello, hi.

speaker: Jake
text: Hey. Oh, I'm sorry about the stench. We're suing a factory that's been dumping raw sewage into a local marshland. Yeah, ten minutes ago, I was knee-deep in liquefied human feces. And that was just on the F train.

speaker: Robin
text: I can't believe Ted's getting back together with Zoey.

speaker: Barney
text: I know. They're a total train wreck.

speaker: Robin
text: Unmitigated disaster.

speaker: Ranjit
text: Worst couple ever.

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah, almost as bad as us.

speaker: Robin
text: We were a mess. Do you remember how awful I looked by the end? My hair was falling out, my skin was gray, my back was hunched.

speaker: Barney
text: What about me? I got so fat, at the end of a date, you'd unhook my bra.

speaker: Robin
text: You were the only boyfriend I ever motorboated.

speaker: Barney
text: Thank God we're not sentimental saps who panic and get back together. Seriously, why would people do that?

speaker: Robin
text: I guess I get it.

speaker: Barney
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Robin
text: Well, no matter how bad things got... Ted really did love Zoey for a minute there. Didn't he?

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah... he did. And... she loved him, too. Didn't she?

speaker: Robin
text: Yeah, she did.

speaker: Ranjit
text: Smith and Ninth Street.

speaker: Jake
text: So, let me show you some of the gut-wrenching environmental atrocities that we were working to stop, okay? Here, pop quiz. What is that?

speaker: Marshall
text: That's a seal.

speaker: Jake
text: Bingo! Yes, a bloated seal corpse rotting in industrial waste.

speaker: Marshall
text: Mm-hmm.

speaker: Jake
text: Now, wait till you see what we found when we cut him open.

speaker: Robin
text: Okay, where the hell are they?

speaker: Barney
text: Maybe this isn't the intersection.

speaker: Robin
text: Well, maybe it is and we're too late. Man, I wish we'd gone to Brooklyn sooner.

speaker: Man
text: I know, right? Ever since the Trader Joe's opened up, Brooklyn is so... whatever.

speaker: Robin
text: Wait. Where'd you get that? (The guy is holding a cup, on which is printed "The Intersection")

speaker: Man
text: Across the street at the Intersection. So, uh, you guys... want to buy some weed or...?

speaker: Barney
text: She's alone! There's still time! But where the hell is Ted?

speaker: Robin
text: Wait a minute. On their first date, he brought her an orchid. How much do you want to bet he's gonna do it again?

speaker: Barney
text: Brilliant. But wait, he had a huge head start on us. There's no way he's still in there unless he spent a half an hour picking out the perfect orchid.
Ted, leaving the florist's shop: Thanks, Julia! You know what? Let me see the pink lady slipper again. (He goes back inside)

speaker: Jake
text: Now, do you know what that is?

speaker: Marshall
text: A pile of rotting seagull carcasses covered in toxic sludge.

speaker: Jake
text: Being eaten by rats. Exactly. Now this next slide... Oh, I'm sorry. That's my wife's water birth. I don't know how that got in there. Anyway, that's all my questions.
Marshall, thinking: Oh, my God, I made it! Now just shake his hand, clench your very soul and run like hell!

speaker: Jake
text: Now, I like to set aside 20 minutes at the end of every interview for your questions. So don't hold back. Whatever you got inside there, you just let 'er rip.
Marshall, thinking: I can't do this anymore. I'm just gonna tell him the truth.

speaker: Lily
text: When it's stomach stuff, you just say "under the weather" or people start picturing you doing unspeakable things.

speaker: Marshall
text: I have food poisoning and I'm about to start volcanoing toxic sludge out of both ends! (Marshall leaves in a hurry)

speaker: Lily
text: Nailed it.

speaker: Ted
text: Thanks, Julia! No, on second thought. (Barney and Robin jumps on him, all three fall down)Ooh! Come on. What the hell?!

speaker: Robin
text: You can't get back together with Zoey just because you're freaking out over a lightbulb.

speaker: Ted
text: I'm not freaking out over a lightbulb! I'm freaking out over 50,000 lightbulbs! I can't do this! I only got this job because you gave it to me, Barney. I didn't earn it!

speaker: Robin
text: Look, Ted, the future is scary. But you can't just run back to the past because it's familiar. Yes, it's tempting.

speaker: Barney
text: But... it's a mistake.

speaker: Ted
text: You're right. (Ted stops an elderly woman who was about to enter the Intersection) Um, excuse me. Can you give this to the blonde sitting alone in there and tell her Ted's really sorry? Also... indirect sunlight. Don't overwater. Half a cup a week is more than enough. (The elderly woman enters and gives theflowers to a blonde sitting alone, but not the right one) No. Hi.
Ted from 2030: And kids... that's how I met your mother. Psych. It was just some chick.

speaker: Lily
text: Hey, baby, how'd it go?

speaker: Marshall
text: Lily, this year, this nasty schoolyard bully of a year will not stop punching me in the face. How did we kick off 2011? My dad died. And now after five months of unemployment, I just blew my dream job. The good news is, in a few seconds, I'm gonna start heaving my guts out because that's what life is for me now: just losing what's inside until I'm just empty.

speaker: Lily
text: Baby, come here.

speaker: Marshall
text: I just want to shut my eyes for a few seconds before it starts. (He lyes down onto the bed and falls asleep)
Ted from 2030: And Marshall slept...all night.

speaker: Rod
text: Okay, hotshot. Mr. Stinson. Who's gonna do the honors?

speaker: Barney
text: He is.

speaker: Ted
text: You sure?

speaker: Barney
text: Yeah. You earned it.

speaker: Rod
text: All clear!

speaker: Ted
text: Hey, new is always better, right?

speaker: Barney
text: Always.

speaker: Rod
text: Ten, nine, eight...

speaker: Marshall
text: Lily, it's a miracle. I didn't get sick. I didn't get sick.

speaker: Lily
text: I know, baby. I'm pregnant.
Rod:...one!

speaker: Robin
text: I'm proud of you for giving Ted the button. It meant a lot.

speaker: Barney
text: It's just a button. Can we talk about something else, please? (Barney sees Norah, Robin says something to him that we can"t hear, then Barney walks up to Norah) Norah.

speaker: Norah
text: Hi.

speaker: Barney
text: How you been?

speaker: Norah
text: Fine.

speaker: Barney
text: Look, I don't know why you would possibly say yes to this, but would you want to grab a cup of coffee with me sometime? 20 minutes. I was such a jerk to you. You can spend the entire time calling me every dirty name in the book.

speaker: Norah
text: I speak four languages. I'm gonna need more than 20 minutes.

speaker: Barney
text: I'll call you. You look beautiful, by the way. And here I thought it was too late for sundresses.

speaker: Norah
text: It's never too late, Barney.

speaker: Barney
text: Challenge accepted.

speaker: Lily
text: Best man? You're being summoned.

speaker: Ted
text: Geez, what now? (He goes inside, enters a room) I heard the groom needed me.

speaker: Barney
text: What do you think of this tie?
